definition: to pry into or spy on/to snoop/to peep/to poke one's nose into/to peer/to get a glimpse of
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

sentences.english: Here are the three most common ways everyone reported snooping
sentences.chinese: 以下是人們提供的三中最常見的窺探方式。

sentences.english: These are the names of the men which Moses sent to spy out the land.
sentences.chinese: 這就是摩西所打發，窺探那地之人的名字。

sentences.english: This exposes your administrative password to anyone looking over your shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 這會向任何窺探您左右的人暴露您的管理密碼。

sentences.english: We were sidetracked for a long time and children came and peeked in.
sentences.chinese: 我們乘的火車在旁軌上停了好久，有些兒童進來窺探。

sentences.english: The thieves cased Wilson's house before the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 那些盜賊在搶劫前窺探了威爾遜的住宅。

sentences.english: 20% of couples had one text snooper.
They left and went up into the hill country, and came to the Valley of Eshcol and explored it.
sentences.chinese: 於是他們起身上山地去，到以實各谷，窺探那地。

sentences.english: The backstage activities are a mysterious world for this youngster.
sentences.chinese: 綵樓背後的戲棚是孩童攀爬窺探的神祕世界。

sentences.english: He skulked around outside until the police had gone.
sentences.chinese: 他窺探著四周，直至見到警察走開。

sentences.english: I'm one individuing who watches what our lecl posters do more thone what our lecl posters promise.
sentences.chinese: 我只是一個窺探我們指導人手腳多過應許的人。

sentences.english: So they went up, and searched the land from the wilderness of Zin unto Rehob, as men come to Hamath.
sentences.chinese: 他們上去窺探那地，從尋的曠野到利合，直到哈馬口。

sentences.english: Well... you could read the documentation or peek at it's source code.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，你當然可以去閱讀文檔或是窺探一下它的源代碼。

sentences.english: I've also come across instances where he has snooped behind my back to find out what I've been doing.
sentences.chinese: 我還在無意中發現，他居然暗中窺探我做的事情。

sentences.english: People guessed, people knew, and eventually it was only a matter of time before it all had to come out.
sentences.chinese: 人們的猜疑，窺探，到最後事情最終被敗露。

sentences.english: And above all, don't go  snooping around the house.
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是，不要在屋子裏四處窺探。

sentences.english: And they turned and went up into the mountain， and came unto the valley of Eshcol， and searched it out.
sentences.chinese: 於是他們起身上山地去，到以實各谷，窺探那地。

definition: to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
to peep at/to spy on/to peek
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
to transform/to convert/to vary/to alternate/a transformation
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
